intro: Fimbristylis ciliata, commonly known as the hairy fringed sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, cylindrical stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typically found in dense clusters at the tips of the stems. It thrives in moist or wet environments, such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of water bodies. Fimbristylis ciliata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions and plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils.
